Q_NAME: Hybrid Inheritance for Student MarkList Percentage
Q_DESC:
Java program to implement Hybrid Inheritance program

1. Create an Interface with name Exam

2. Create a method in the interface as percent_cal() with method return type as void that takes no arguments

3. Create a class Student and declare data members and methods as follows

a. name = String
b. roll_no, mark1 and mark2 as Integer
c. Create a Constructor Parameterised for Student class that takes four arguments as n of type String, r , m1 and m2of types integer
d. Assign the parameterised argument to dataMembers of Student class

4. Create an another method in Student class as follows

a. Method name= display
b. Argument = None
c. Return Type = void
d. Usage = Print the name, roll_no, mark1 and mark2

5. Create a class  Result that extends Student class and implements Exam interface

6. Create a Constructor Parameterised for Result class that takes four arguments as n of type String, r , m1 and m2 of types integer

7. Use super(n,r,m1,m2) so that it access the Base Class constructor
Note: super keyword in Result class will call Student class (Base class for Result class).

8. Implement the percent_cal method and calculate the total and percentage
Note: Declare variable total and percentage and print the percentage result

9. Implement the display follows

a. Method name= display
b. Argument = None
c. Return Type = void
Note:
Call the Base class method display using super keyword (super.display())

10. In main class get the input of name as String, regno, mark1 ,mark2 as Integer

11. Create an instance for Result Class R with parameterised constructor that takes four arguments [name,regno,mark1,mark2] 

12. Invoke display method first and percent_cal method second
TESTCASE_1:
Mani
22
67
98
###---###SEPERATOR---###---
Name of Student=Mani
Roll No of Student=22
Marks of Subject 1=67
Marks of Subject 2=98
Percentage=82.5%
